third exchange of captives occurred on 26 November. Hamas released 17 hostages.<ref name=ap26nov>{{cite web|url=https://apnews.com/article/israel-hamas-war-news-11-26-2023-556b251fadc25a234a499e957edd218d|title=Hamas releases third group of hostages as part of truce and says it will seek to extend the deal|work=[[Associated Press]]|access-date=26 November 2023|date=26 November 2023|last1=Shurafa|first1=Wafaa|last2=Magdy|first2=Samy}}</ref> 11 Israeli hostages were released on 27 November.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/nine-children-two-mothers-released-from-hamas-captivity-as-truce-holds-for-4th-day/|title=9 children, including 3-year-old twins, and 2 mothers released from Hamas captivity|date=27 November 2023|accessdate=27 November 2023|work=[[The Times of Israel]]}}</ref>

2023|title=What is Known About Israeli Hostages Taken by Hamas {{!}} AJC|url=https://www.ajc.org/news/what-is-known-about-israeli-hostages-taken-by-hamas |access-date=6 November 2023 |website=www.ajc.org |language=en}}</ref> elderly people,<ref>{{Citation |title=יפה בת ה-85 נחטפה לעזה: "מה היא עוברת שם, מפרק לי את הלב"|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oYytwfua9TM |access-date=16 November 2023 |language=en}}</ref> and pregnant women.<ref>{{Cite web |date=16 November 2023 |title=Pregnant hostage gives birth in Gaza, Sara Netanyahu pleads for help|url=https://www.jpost.com/israel-news/article-773481 |access-date=16 November 2023 |website=The Jerusalem Post|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=15 November 2023 |title=Woman who gave birth in Hamas captivity is a Thai foreign worker, Israeli officials say |language=en |work=Ynetnews|url=https://www.ynetnews.com/article/hk00dwhzn6 |access-date=16 November 2023}}</ref> The precise ratio of soldiers and civilians among the captives is unknown. The captives are likely being held in different locations in the Gaza Strip.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news |last=i24NEWS |date=8 October 2023 |title=Hamas plans to use Israeli civilian hostages as human shields |language=en |work=[[i24NEWS (Israeli TV channel)|I24news]]|url=https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel-at-war/1696753484-hamas-plans-to-use-israeli-civilian-hostages-as-human-shields |url-status=live |access-date=10 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231010155021/https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel-at-war/1696753484-hamas-plans-to-use-israeli-civilian-hostages-as-human-shields |archive-date=10 October 2023}}</ref>In addition to full Israeli citizens, almost half of the hostages include [[multiple citizenship|dual citizens]] and foreign nationals.<ref>{{Cite news |date=25 October 2023 |title=More than half of Hamas' hostages have foreign nationality - Israel|language=en|work=Reuters|url=https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/more-than-half-hamas-hostages-have-foreign-nationality-israel-2023-10-25/ |access-date=6 November 2023}}</ref>

Their families wait in agony|url=https://apnews.com/article/children-hostages-israel-palestinians-gaza-orphan-c8e9f6dd703a9c14161eeb6ca9e25417|access-date=6 November 2023 |website=[[Associated |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=ynet|date=22 October 2023 |title=240 חטופים: השמות, הפנים, הסיפורים ¡|language=he|work=Ynet|url=https://www.ynet.co.il/news/article/r17c5000w6 |website=www.ajc.org |language=en}}</ref> elderly people,<ref>{{Citation |title=יפה בת ה-85 נחטפה לעזה: "מה היא עוברת שם, מפרק לי את הלב"|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oYytwfua9TM |access-date=16 November 2023 |language=en}}</ref> and pregnant women.<ref>{{Cite web |date=16 November 2023 |title=Pregnant hostage gives birth in Gaza, Sara Netanyahu pleads for help|url=https://www.jpost.com/israel-news/article-773481 |access-date=16 November 2023 |website=The Jerusalem Post|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=15 November 2023 |title=Woman who gave ratio of soldiers and civilians among the captives is unknown. The captives are likely being held in different locations in the Gaza Strip.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news |last=i24NEWS |date=8 October 2023 |title=Hamas plans to use Israeli civilian hostages as human shields |language=en |work=[[i24NEWS (Israeli TV channel)|I24news]]|url=https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel-at-war/1696753484-hamas-plans-to-use-israeli-civilian-hostages-as-human-shields |url-status=live |access-date=10 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231010155021/https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel-at-war/1696753484-hamas-plans-to-use-israeli-civilian-hostages-as-human-shields |archive-date=10 October 2023}}</ref> In addition to full Israeli citizens, almost half of the hostages include [[multiple citizenship|dual citizens]] and foreign nationals.<ref>{{Cite news |date=25 October 2023 |title=More than half of Hamas' hostages have foreign nationality - Israel|language=en|work=Reuters|url=https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/more-than-half-hamas-hostages-have-foreign-nationality-israel-2023-10-25/ |access-date=6 November 2023}}</ref> 
 
 Hamas has offered to release all hostages in exchange for Israel releasing all Palestinian prisoners.<ref name="allforall" /> By October 2023, Israel held 5,200 Palestinians (including 170 juveniles) in its prisons. Hamas stated its objective was to secure their release.<ref name="aj1">{{cite news |date=8 October 2023 |title=Why are so many Palestinian prisoners in Israeli jails? |work=[[Al Jazeera English]]|url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/8/why-are-so-many-palestinian-prisoners-in-israeli-jails |url-status=live |access-date=9 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231008155702/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/8/why-are-so-many-palestinian-prisoners-in-israeli-jails |archive-date=8 October 2023}}</ref> Several countries have been involved in negotiations between Israel and Hamas, with [[Qatar]] taking the lead.<ref name="Guardian-Burke">{{Cite news |last=Burke |first=Jason |title=Two Israeli hostages released as efforts intensify to free people held by Hamas|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/23/efforts-to-free-gaza-hostages-intensify-amid-reports-some-may-soon-be-released |date=23 October 2023 |access-date=23 October 2023 |work=[[The Guardian]] |archive-date=23 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231023182204/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/23/efforts-to-free-gaza-hostages-intensify-amid-reports-some-may-soon-be-released |url-status=live }}</ref>

diffText:
@@ -177,4 +177,5 @@
 
 ==== Surrendered Israeli hostages ====
+{{Further|Killing of Alon Shamriz, Yotam Haim, and Samer Talalka}}
 On 15 December, the IDF released a statement announcing that they had killed three of their own hostages by [[friendly fire]]. According to the Israeli military, they "mistakenly identified three Israeli hostages as a threat" during operations in [[Shuja'iyya]] and subsequently fired at them, killing them.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Tabachnick |first1=Cara |date=15 December 2023 |title=3 hostages in Gaza were killed by friendly fire, Israeli military says - CBS News |work=www.cbsnews.com |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/3-hostages-in-gaza-killed-by-friendly-fire-israeli-military-says/ |access-date=15 December 2023}}</ref><ref name=":3">{{cite news |date=15 December 2023 |title=Israel-Hamas war live updates: IDF says it mistakenly killed 3 Israeli hostages during fighting |language=en |work=NBC News |url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/live-blog/israel-hamas-war-live-updates-rcna129901 |access-date=15 December 2023}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=IDF troops mistakenly open fire and kill 3 hostages in northern Gaza battlefield |url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/idf-troops-mistakenly-open-fire-and-kill-3-hostages-in-northern-gaza-battlefield/ |publisher=Times of Israel}}</ref> According to an Israeli military official on 16 December, the three hostages were shirtless and waving a [[white flag]]. The official claimed that one soldier responded to this by "open[ing] fire" and "declar[ing] that they're terrorists"; more Israeli forces fired, killing two hostages "immediately" and wounding the third hostage, who appealed for help in Hebrew.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Lubell |first1=Maayan |date=16 December 2023 |title=Israeli hostages killed in Gaza were holding white flag, official says |work=[[Reuters]] |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-hostages-killed-mistakenly-gaza-were-holding-white-flag-official-says-2023-12-16/ |access-date=16 December 2023}}</ref> The wounded hostage was pursued into a nearby building by IDF soldiers, where he was killed despite continued pleas for help.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Beaumont |first=Peter |date=16 December 2023 |title=IDF says Israeli hostages it killed in Gaza were bare chested and waving white flag |language=en-GB |work=The Observer |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/dec/16/idf-says-hostages-it-killed-were-bare-chested-and-waving-white-flag |access-date= |issn=0029-7712}}</ref> Though he claimed that the soldiers were "under pressure" when this happened, Lieutenant General [[Herzi Halevi]] also stated that "It is forbidden to shoot at someone who raises a white flag and seeks to surrender", a sentiment echoed by former head of [[Mossad]] [[Danny Yatom]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Said |first=Summer |last2=Cloud |first2=David S. |last3=Keller-Lynn |first3=Carrie |date=16 December 2023 |title=Israel Says Its Soldiers Killed Israeli Hostages as They Held Up White Flag |url=https://www.wsj.com/world/middle-east/israel-and-qatar-explore-revival-of-deal-for-gaza-hostages-ff7af151 |website=WSJ}}</ref>

label: DOES NOT AFFECT npov
diffText:
@@ -43,5 +43,5 @@
 
 === Public statements by officials ===
-After the 7 October attacks by Hamas, [[Yoav Gallant]], Israeli Minister of Defense, stated "We are fighting human animals, and we are acting accordingly".<ref name=":3">{{Cite web |last=Buxbaum |first=Jessica |date=2023-11-30 |title='Erase Gaza': How genocidal rhetoric is normalised in Israel |url=https://www.newarab.com/analysis/erase-gaza-how-genocidal-rhetoric-normalised-israel |access-date=2023-12-29 |website=[[New Arab]] |language=en}}</ref> [[Avi Dichter]], Israeli Minister of Agriculture, called for the war to be "Gaza’s [[Nakba]]" on Channel 12;<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |date=2023-11-14 |title=Israel right-wing ministers' comments add fuel to Palestinian fears |url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/gaza-nakba-israels-far-right-palestinian-fears-hamas-war-rcna123909 |access-date=2023-12-29 |website=NBC News |language=en}}</ref> [[Ariel Kallner]], another Member of the [[Knesset]], similarly wrote on social media that there is "one goal: Nakba! A Nakba that will overshadow the Nakba of [1948]. Nakba in Gaza and Nakba to anyone who dares to join".<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-10-13 |title=In Israel's call for mass evacuation, Palestinians hear echoes of their original catastrophic exodus |url=https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-gaza-evacuation-history-nakba-a1bec1ee3477573e80b39b4044a48111 |access-date=2024-01-05 |website=AP News |language=en}}</ref> Amihai Eliyahu, Israeli Minister of Heritage, called for dropping an atomic bomb on Gaza.<ref name=":0" /> [[President of Israel]] [[Isaac Herzog]] blamed the whole nation of Palestine for the 7 October attack.<ref name="Time13Nov" />
+After the 7 October attacks by Hamas, [[Yoav Gallant]], Israeli Minister of Defense, stated "We are fighting human animals, and we are acting accordingly".<ref name=":3">{{Cite web |last=Buxbaum |first=Jessica |date=2023-11-30 |title='Erase Gaza': How genocidal rhetoric is normalised in Israel |url=https://www.newarab.com/analysis/erase-gaza-how-genocidal-rhetoric-normalised-israel |access-date=2023-12-29 |website=[[New Arab]] |language=en}}</ref> [[Avi Dichter]], Israeli Minister of Agriculture, called for the war to be "Gaza’s [[Nakba]]" on Channel 12;<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |date=2023-11-14 |title=Israel right-wing ministers' comments add fuel to Palestinian fears |url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/gaza-nakba-israels-far-right-palestinian-fears-hamas-war-rcna123909 |access-date=2023-12-29 |website=NBC News |language=en}}</ref> [[Ariel Kallner]], another Member of the [[Knesset]] from the [[Likud]] party, similarly wrote on social media that there is "one goal: Nakba!  '''Donna Hylton''' (born October 29, 1964) is an [[Jamaica, West Indies|Jamaican-American]] activist, focusing on reform of the justice system and issues facing incarcerated and formerly incarcerated women and girls. 
   
-Hylton is currently highlighting gender-based violence and sexual abuse  as a direct link to the choices, circumstances and psychological factors that result in the incarceration of women and girls. Most recently, she was a featured speaker at the [[2017 Women's March|Women's March on Washington]].<ref name="2017march">{{cite web|title=Speakers|url=https://www.womensmarch.com/speakers|accessdate=January 23, 2017}}</ref><ref>http://dailycaller.com/2017/01/26/womens-march-featured-speaker-who-kidnapped-raped-and-tortured-a-man/</ref> She has  advocated the 'compassionated release' of aging prisoners based on humanitarian principles.<ref name="Quartz">{{cite web|url=https://qz.com/634453/keeping-elderly-inmates-behind-bars-makes-a-mockery-of-our-so-called-justice-system|title=Keeping rehabilitated inmates behind bars makes a mockery of America's so-called justice system|first=Keri|last=Blakinger|date=March 9, 2016}}</ref[http://www.wnd.com/2017/01/womens-march-speakera-kidnapper-murderer Profile], wnd.com, January 2017; accessed January 31, 2017.</ref>

 ==Background==
+[[File:Yom Kippur War Montage.png|thumb|Iconic images of Yom Kippur War]] 
 The war was part of the [[Arab–Israeli conflict]], an ongoing dispute that included many battles and wars since 1948, when the state of Israel was formed. During the Six-Day War of 1967, Israel had captured Egypt's Sinai Peninsula, roughly half of Syria's Golan Heights, and the territories of the [[West Bank]] which had been [[Jordanian annexation of the West Bank|held by Jordan since 1948]].<ref>{{cite book|author=Shlomo Ben-Ami |title=Scars of War, Wounds of Peace: The Israeli–Arab Tragedy |year=2005 |publisher=Phoenix |isbn=978-0-7538-2104-6}}</ref>

diffText:
@@ -59,5 +59,5 @@
 The [[Intercommunal conflict in Mandatory Palestine|sectarian conflict]] between Palestinian Jews and Arabs emerged in the early 20th century, peaking into a full-scale [[1947–48 Civil War in Mandatory Palestine|civil war]] in 1947 and transforming into the [[1948 Arab–Israeli War|First Arab–Israeli War]] in May 1948, following the [[Israeli Declaration of Independence]]. Large-scale hostilities mostly ended with the cease-fire agreements after the 1973 [[Yom Kippur War]]. Peace agreements were signed between Israel and Egypt in 1979, resulting in Israeli withdrawal from the Sinai Peninsula and abolishment of the [[Israeli Military Governorate|military governance system]] in the West Bank and Gaza Strip, in favor of [[Israeli Civil Administration]] and consequent unilateral annexation of the Golan Heights and East Jerusalem.
 
-The nature of the conflict has shifted over the years from the large-scale, regional Arab–Israeli conflict to a more local [[Israeli–Palestinian conflict]], which peaked during the [[1982 Lebanon War]]. With the decline of the [[First Palestinian Intifada]], the interim [[Oslo Accords]] led to the creation of the [[Palestinian National Authority]] in 1994, within the context of the [[Israeli–Palestinian peace process]]. The same year Israel and Jordan reached a peace accord. A cease-fire has been largely maintained between Israel and Baathist Syria, as well as with Lebanon since 2006. Despite the peace agreements with Egypt and Jordan, interim peace accords with Palestine and the generally existing cease-fire, the Arab League and Israel remain at odds with each other over many issues.
+The nature of the conflict has shifted over the years from the large-scale, regional Arab–Israeli conflict to a more local [[Israeli–Palestinian conflict]], which peaked during the [[1982 Lebanon War]]. With the decline of the [[First Palestinian Intifada]], the interim [[Oslo Accords]] led to the creation of the [[Palestinian National Authority]] in 1994, within the context of the [[Israeli–Palestinian peace process]]. The same year Israel and Jordan reached a peace accord. A cease-fire has been largely maintained between Israel and Baathist Syria, as well as with Lebanon since 2006. Despite the peace agreements with Egypt and Jordan, interim peace accords with the Palestinian Authority and the generally existing cease-fire, the Arab League and Israel remain at odds with each other over many issues.
 
 Developments in the course of the Syrian Civil War reshuffled the situation near Israel's northern border, putting the [[Syrian Arab Republic]], [[Hezbollah]] and the [[Syrian opposition]] at odds with each other and complicating their relations with Israel. The conflict between Israel and [[Hamas]]-ruled [[Gaza City|Gaza]], which resulted in the 2014 cease-fire, is usually also considered part of the Israeli–Palestinian conflict. Its 2006–2012 phase is, however, also attributed to the [[Iran–Israel proxy conflict]] in the region ([[Syria]] and [[Hezbollah]] are being supported by Iran). Since 2012, Iran (predominantly [[Shia Islam|Shia]]) has cut ties with the [[Sunni Islam|Sunni]] [[Hamas]] movement on account of the latter's support for the [[Syrian opposition|opposition]] in the [[Syrian Civil War]].

@@ -157,5 +157,5 @@
 Various [[Government of Israel|Israeli Cabinets]] have made political statements and many of Israel's citizens and supporters [[Military occupation#Disputed to be a military occupation by nation of dominant military forces in area|dispute]] that the territories are occupied and claim that use of the term "occupied" in relation to [[Israel]]'s control of the areas has no basis in [[international law]] or [[Land of Israel#The Land of Israel and the State of Israel|history]], and that it prejudges the outcome of any future or ongoing [[Israeli–Palestinian peace process|negotiations]]. They argue it is more accurate to refer to the territories as "[[International law and the Arab–Israeli conflict#"Occupied" vs. "Disputed" territories|disputed]]" rather than "[[Military occupation|occupied]]" although they agree to apply the humanitarian provisions of the [[Fourth Geneva Convention]] pending resolution of the dispute. [[Yoram Dinstein]], has dismissed the position that they are not occupied as being "based on dubious legal grounds".<ref>see Yoram Dinstein, ‘The International Law of Belligerent Occupation and Human Rights’, 8 Israeli Yearbook on Human Rights 104, 107 (1978) and [http://uninews.unimelb.edu.au/view.php?articleID=5387 International law expert, Professor Yoram Dinstein, on the international ‘War on Terrorism’] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100402070502/http://uninews.unimelb.edu.au/view.php?articleID=5387 |date=2010-04-02 }}</ref> Many Israeli government websites do refer to the areas as being "occupied territories".<ref>[https://www.knesset.gov.il/mk/eng/mk_eng.asp?mk_individual_id_t=690 Public activities section of Ezer Weizman's Knesset profile]. Knesset.gov.il. Retrieved on 2012-01-15.</ref> According to the BBC, "Israel argues that the international conventions relating to occupied land do not apply to the Palestinian territories because they were not under the legitimate sovereignty of any state in the first place."<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/in_depth/middle_east/israel_and_the_palestinians/key_documents/1682640.stm "The Geneva Convention"], Israel and the Palestinians, BBC News</ref>
 
-In the ''Report on the Legal Status of Building in Judea and Samaria'', usually referred to as ''[[Levy Report]]'', published in July 2012, a three-member committee headed by former Israeli Supreme Court justice [[Edmund Levy]] which was appointed by Prime Minister [[Binyamin Netanyahu]] comes to the conclusion that Israel's presence in the West Bank is not an occupation in the legal sense,<ref name="NYTValidate">{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/10/world/middleeast/israeli-panel-says-west-bank-presence-is-not-occupation-and-recommends-approval-of-jewish-settlements.html|title=Validate Settlements, Israeli Panel Suggests |work=The New York Times |author=Isabel Kershner|date=9 July 2012 |accessdate=10 July 2012}}</ref> and that the Israeli settlements in those territories do not contravene international law.<ref name="JP276802">{{cite web |url=http://www.jpost.com/DiplomacyAndPolitics/Article.aspx?ID=276802&R=R1 |title=PM to decide on Levy report with settlement c'tee |work=The Jerusalem Post |author=Lahav Harkov |date=9 July 2012 |accessdate=10 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120714031343/http://www.jpost.com/DiplomacyAndPolitics/Article.aspx?ID=276802&R=R1 |archivedate=14 July 2012 |df= }}</ref> The report has met with both approval and harsh criticism in Israel and outside. As of July 2013, the report was not brought before the Israeli cabinet or any parliamentary or governmental body which would have the power to approve it.
+In the ''Report on the Legal Status of Building in Judea and Samaria'', usually referred to as ''[[Levy Report]]'', published in July 2012, a three-member committee headed by former Israeli Supreme Court justice [[Edmund Levy]] which was appointed by Prime Minister [[Binyamin Netanyahu]] comes to the conclusion that Israel's presence in the West Bank is not an occupation in the legal sense,<ref name="NYTValidate">{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/10/world/middleeast/israeli-panel-says-west-bank-presence-is-not-occupation-and-recommends-approval-of-jewish-settlements.html|title=Validate Settlements, Israeli Panel Suggests |work=The New York Times |author=Isabel Kershner|date=9 July 2012 |accessdate=10 July 2012}}</ref> and that the Israeli settlements in those territories do not contravene international law.<ref name="JP276802">{{cite web |url=http://www.jpost.com/Diplomacy-and-Politics/PM-to-decide-on-Levy-report-with-settlement-ctee |title=PM to decide on Levy report with settlement c'tee |work=The Jerusalem Post |author=Lahav Harkov |date=9 July 2012 |accessdate=13 January 2018 }}</ref> The report has met with both approval and harsh criticism in Israel and outside. As of July 2013, the report was not brought before the Israeli cabinet or any parliamentary or governmental body which would have the power to approve it.
 
 ====Israeli Jewish religious views====

@@ -33,5 +33,5 @@
 On 7 October 2023, around 70 [[Hamas]] militants attacked [[Kfar Aza]], a [[kibbutz]] about {{Convert|3|km|mi|sp=us}} from the border with the [[Gaza Strip]], massacring residents and [[2023 Gaza Strip kidnappings|abducting several hostages]]. 
 
-The kibbutz had 400 residents prior to the attack, and it took two days for the [[Israel Defense Forces]] to wrest back full control of the community.<ref name="cbs" /><ref name="NBCnews">{{Cite news |last=Tenbarge |first=Kat |last2=Chan |first2=Melissa |date=12 October 2023 |title=Unverified reports of '40 babies beheaded' in Israel-Hamas war inflame social media |publisher=[[NBC News]]|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/internet/unverified-allegations-beheaded-babies-israel-hamas-war-inflame-social-rcna119902 |url-status=live |access-date=12 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231012182948/https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/internet/unverified-allegations-beheaded-babies-israel-hamas-war-inflame-social-rcna119902 |archive-date=12 October 2023}}</ref><ref name="jpost12oct" /> While the exact total of Israelis killed is yet unknown, as of 15 October, 52 are listed as dead, and a further 20 or more missing.<ref name ="Tzuri">{{cite web|first=Matan|last=Tzuri|url=https://www.ynetnews.com/article/s1isvvtba|title=A quarter of the residents of Nir Oz are either dead or missing|work=[[Ynet]]|date=15 October 2023}}</ref><ref name=":4">{{Cite news |last=Spencer |first=Richard |date=13 October 2023 |title=They came at dawn: inside the Kfar Aza kibbutz massacre |work=[[The Times]] |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/kibbutz-israel-kfar-aza-israel-hamas-war-k8h77bskq |access-date=14 October 2023 |archive-date=14 October 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231014095537/https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/kibbutz-israel-kfar-aza-israel-hamas-war-k8h77bskq |url-status=live }}</ref> 
+The kibbutz had 400 residents prior to the attack, and it took two days for the [[Israel Defense Forces]] to wrest back full control of the community.<ref name="cbs" /><ref name="NBCnews">{{Cite news |last1=Tenbarge |first1=Kat |last2=Chan |first2=Melissa |date=12 October 2023 |title=Unverified reports of '40 babies beheaded' in Israel-Hamas war inflame social media |publisher=[[NBC News]]|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/internet/unverified-allegations-beheaded-babies-israel-hamas-war-inflame-social-rcna119902 |url-status=live |access-date=12 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231012182948/https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/internet/unverified-allegations-beheaded-babies-israel-hamas-war-inflame-social-rcna119902 |archive-date=12 October 2023}}</ref><ref name="jpost12oct" /> While the exact total of Israelis killed is yet unknown, as of 15 October, 52 are listed as dead, and a further 20 or more missing.<ref name ="Tzuri">{{cite web|first=Matan|last=Tzuri|url=https://www.ynetnews.com/article/s1isvvtba|title=A quarter of the residents of Nir Oz are either dead or missing|work=[[Ynet]]|date=15 October 2023}}</ref><ref name=":4">{{Cite news |last=Spencer |first=Richard |date=13 October 2023 |title=They came at dawn: inside the Kfar Aza kibbutz massacre |work=[[The Times]] |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/kibbutz-israel-kfar-aza-israel-hamas-war-k8h77bskq |access-date=14 October 2023 |archive-date=14 October 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231014095537/https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/kibbutz-israel-kfar-aza-israel-hamas-war-k8h77bskq |url-status=live }}</ref> 
 
 The attack is notable for claims of brutality in the form of beheadings,<ref name="cbs" /> dismemberment, and victims having [[death by burning|been burned alive]].<ref name=AFP>{{Cite news |first=Patrick |last=Anidjar |date=16 October 2023 |title='Never seen such barbarity': the grim task of Israel's forensics teams |url=https://news.yahoo.com/never-seen-barbarity-grim-task-192626960.html |access-date=17 October 2023 |publisher=Yahoo News |agency=Agence France-Presse |language=en-US |archive-date=22 October 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231022174244/https://news.yahoo.com/never-seen-barbarity-grim-task-192626960.html |url-status=live}}</ref> There has been controversy by the Israeli sources regarding unconfirmed claims that babies were decapitated.<ref name="NBCnews" /><ref name="skn">{{cite web |date=12 October 2023 |title=What we actually know about the viral report of beheaded babies in Israel|url=https://news.sky.com/story/amp/its-important-to-separate-the-facts-from-speculation-what-we-actually-know-about-the-viral-report-of-beheaded-babies-in-israel-12982329 |access-date=12 October 2023|publisher=Sky News |archive-date=11 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231011175713/https://news.sky.com/story/amp/its-important-to-separate-the-facts-from-speculation-what-we-actually-know-about-the-viral-report-of-beheaded-babies-in-israel-12982329 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=":6"/>

 == Massacre ==
 [[File:Kefar_Aza_Kibutz_IMG_6886.JPG|thumb|300px|Kefar Aza prior to the massacre]]
-About 70 Hamas gunmen broke through a fence and gained  access to the kibbutz on the morning of 7&nbsp;October 2023.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|last=Lubell |first=Maayan |date=10 October 2023 |title=Insight: How an Israeli kibbutz 'paradise' turned into hell in Hamas attack|work=[[Reuters]]|url=https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/bodies-residents-militants-lie-grounds-ravaged-israeli-kibbutz-2023-10-10/ |url-status=live |access-date=10 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231010155605/https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/bodies-residents-militants-lie-grounds-ravaged-israeli-kibbutz-2023-10-10/ |archive-date=10 October 2023}}</ref> After entering the kibbutz, which was {{Convert|3|km|mi|sp=us}} from Gaza, the militants proceeded to massacre residents of the community.<ref name=":0" /> The Islamist militants began by targeting the west side of the community—an area in the kibbutz close to Gaza - where families with young children lived.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news |last=Pfeffer |first=Anshel |date=10 October 2023 |title=Bitterness and fury at the kibbutz where babies had their throats cut |work=[[The Times]]|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/bitterness-and-fury-at-the-kibbutz-where-babies-had-their-throats-cut-z7nz56rn9 |access-date=10 October 2023 |archive-date=12 October 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231012193702/https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/kibbutz-israel-kfar-aza-massacre-gaza-strip-z7nz56rn9 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite news |last=Hendrix |first=Steve |date=10 October 2023 |title=Scenes from a massacre: Inside an Israeli town destroyed by Hamas |work=[[The Washington Post]]|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/10/10/israel-hamas-attack-war-death/ |access-date=10 October 2023 |archive-date=12 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231012193708/https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/10/10/israel-hamas-attack-war-death/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Fifty two people at the kibbutz are known to have been killed.<ref name="Tzuri" />  
+About 70 Hamas gunmen broke through a fence and gained  access to the kibbutz on the morning of 7&nbsp;October 2023.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|last=Lubell |first=Maayan |date=10 October 2023 |title=Insight: How an Israeli kibbutz 'paradise' turned into hell in Hamas attack|work=[[Reuters]]|url=https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/bodies-residents-militants-lie-grounds-ravaged-israeli-kibbutz-2023-10-10/ |url-status=live |access-date=10 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231010155605/https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/bodies-residents-militants-lie-grounds-ravaged-israeli-kibbutz-2023-10-10/ |archive-date=10 October 2023}}</ref> After entering the kibbutz, which was {{Convert|3|km|mi|sp=us}} from Gaza, the militants proceeded to massacre residents of the community.<ref name=":0" /> The Islamist militants began by targeting the west side of the community—an area in the kibbutz close to Gaza - where families with young children lived.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news |last=Pfeffer |first=Anshel |date=10 October 2023 |title=Bitterness and fury at the kibbutz where babies had their throats cut |work=[[The Times]]|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/bitterness-and-fury-at-the-kibbutz-where-babies-had-their-throats-cut-z7nz56rn9 |access-date=10 October 2023 |archive-date=12 October 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231012193702/https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/kibbutz-israel-kfar-aza-massacre-gaza-strip-z7nz56rn9 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite news |last=Hendrix |first=Steve |date=10 October 2023 |title=Scenes from a massacre: Inside an Israeli town destroyed by Hamas |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]]|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/10/10/israel-hamas-attack-war-death/ |access-date=10 October 2023 |archive-date=12 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231012193708/https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/10/10/israel-hamas-attack-war-death/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Fifty two people at the kibbutz are known to have been killed.<ref name="Tzuri" />  
 
-Members of the kibbutz with military training, who formed a volunteer armed guard, fought against invading militants in an attempt to defend the community.<ref name=":2" /> All were killed. Hamas  militants  broadened the attack to all four directions.<ref name=":1" /> Invading militants burned houses and killed civilian residents.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Hutchinson |first=Bill |date=10 October 2023 |title=Mom says sons snatched by Hamas while on the phone with her |work=[[ABC News]]|url=https://abcnews.go.com/International/rules-israeli-mom-begs-return-2-sons-kidnapped/story?id=103856079 |access-date=11 October 2023|archive-date=11 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231011003547/https://abcnews.go.com/International/rules-israeli-mom-begs-return-2-sons-kidnapped/story?id=103856079 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|date=10 October 2023 |title=Smell of death fills Israeli kibbutz where civilians were slain |work=[[France 24]] |agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|url=https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20231010-smell-of-death-fills-israeli-kibbutz-where-civilians-were-slain |access-date=11 October 2023 |archive-date=12 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231012193700/https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20231010-smell-of-death-fills-israeli-kibbutz-where-civilians-were-slain |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=":3">{{Cite news |last=Oliphant |first=Roland |last2=Vasilyeva |first2=Nataliya |date=10 October 2023 |title=Babies killed in Hamas attacks on kibbutz as death toll passes 1,000 |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2023/10/10/babies-killed-hamas-attacks-kibbutz-israel/ |url-status=live |access-date=10 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231010184500/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2023/10/10/babies-killed-hamas-attacks-kibbutz-israel/ |archive-date=10 October 2023}}</ref> Corpses of those who had lived in the community were found with their hands tied.<ref name=":3" /> 
+Members of the kibbutz with military training, who formed a volunteer armed guard, fought against invading militants in an attempt to defend the community.<ref name=":2" /> All were killed. Hamas  militants  broadened the attack to all four directions.<ref name=":1" /> Invading militants burned houses and killed civilian residents.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Hutchinson |first=Bill |date=10 October 2023 |title=Mom says sons snatched by Hamas while on the phone with her |work=[[ABC News]]|url=https://abcnews.go.com/International/rules-israeli-mom-begs-return-2-sons-kidnapped/story?id=103856079 |access-date=11 October 2023|archive-date=11 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231011003547/https://abcnews.go.com/International/rules-israeli-mom-begs-return-2-sons-kidnapped/story?id=103856079 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|date=10 October 2023 |title=Smell of death fills Israeli kibbutz where civilians were slain |work=[[France 24]] |agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|url=https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20231010-smell-of-death-fills-israeli-kibbutz-where-civilians-were-slain |access-date=11 October 2023 |archive-date=12 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231012193700/https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20231010-smell-of-death-fills-israeli-kibbutz-where-civilians-were-slain |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=":3">{{Cite news |last1=Oliphant |first1=Roland |last2=Vasilyeva |first2=Nataliya |date=10 October 2023 |title=Babies killed in Hamas attacks on kibbutz as death toll passes 1,000 |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2023/10/10/babies-killed-hamas-attacks-kibbutz-israel/ |url-status=live |access-date=10 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231010184500/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2023/10/10/babies-killed-hamas-attacks-kibbutz-israel/ |archive-date=10 October 2023}}</ref> Corpses of those who had lived in the community were found with their hands tied.<ref name=":3" /> 
 
-In addition, the militants took hostages from the kibbutz.<ref name="reuters" /><ref>{{Cite news |last=Logan |first=Nick |date=10 October 2023 |title=Why Hamas took so many people hostage — and how that complicates Israel's response|work=[[CBC News]]|url=https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/israel-gaza-hamas-hostages-1.6991077 |access-date=10 October 2023 |archive-date=10 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231010190517/https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/israel-gaza-hamas-hostages-1.6991077 |url-status=live }}</ref> The [[Associated Press]] visually confirmed four hostages who were abducted on 7 October.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Federman|first=Josef|last2=Adwan|first2=Issam |date=7 October 2023 |title=Hamas surprise attack out of Gaza stuns Israel and leaves hundreds dead in fighting, retaliation |work=[[Associated Press]]|url=https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-gaza-hamas-rockets-airstrikes-tel-aviv-11fb98655c256d54ecb5329284fc37d2 |access-date=11 October 2023 |archive-date=7 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231007073124/https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-gaza-hamas-rockets-airstrikes-tel-aviv-11fb98655c256d54ecb5329284fc37d2 |url-status=live }}</ref> The militants took women, children and senior citizens among the hostages back to Gaza.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Logan |first=Nick |date=10 October 2023 |title=Why Hamas took so many people hostage — and how that complicates Israel's response |work=[[CBC News]] |url=https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/israel-gaza-hamas-hostages-1.6991077 |url-status=live |access-date=10 October 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231010190517/https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/israel-gaza-hamas-hostages-1.6991077 |archive-date=10 October 2023}}</ref>
+In addition, the militants took hostages from the kibbutz.<ref name="reuters" /><ref>{{Cite news |last=Logan |first=Nick |date=10 October 2023 |title=Why Hamas took so many people hostage — and how that complicates Israel's response|work=[[CBC News]]|url=https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/israel-gaza-hamas-hostages-1.6991077 |access-date=10 October 2023 |archive-date=10 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231010190517/https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/israel-gaza-hamas-hostages-1.6991077 |url-status=live }}</ref> The [[Associated Press]] visually confirmed four hostages who were abducted on 7 October.<ref>{{Cite news|last1=Federman|first1=Josef|last2=Adwan|first2=Issam |date=7 October 2023 |title=Hamas surprise attack out of Gaza stuns Israel and leaves hundreds dead in fighting, retaliation |work=[[Associated Press]]|url=https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-gaza-hamas-rockets-airstrikes-tel-aviv-11fb98655c256d54ecb5329284fc37d2 |access-date=11 October 2023 |archive-date=7 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231007073124/https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-gaza-hamas-rockets-airstrikes-tel-aviv-11fb98655c256d54ecb5329284fc37d2 |url-status=live }}</ref> The militants took women, children and senior citizens among the hostages back to Gaza.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Logan |first=Nick |date=10 October 2023 |title=Why Hamas took so many people hostage — and how that complicates Israel's response |work=[[CBC News]] |url=https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/israel-gaza-hamas-hostages-1.6991077 |url-status=live |access-date=10 October 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231010190517/https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/israel-gaza-hamas-hostages-1.6991077 |archive-date=10 October 2023}}</ref>
 
 Israeli Major General [[Itai Veruv]] described the massacre as a [[Terrorism|terror attack]].<ref name="reuters">{{Cite news |last=Lubell |first=Maayan|date=10 October 2023 |title=Bodies of residents and militants lie in the grounds of ravaged Israeli kibbutz|language=en|work=Reuters|url=https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/bodies-residents-militants-lie-grounds-ravaged-israeli-kibbutz-2023-10-10/ |access-date=10 October 2023 |archive-date=10 October 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231010155605/https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/bodies-residents-militants-lie-grounds-ravaged-israeli-kibbutz-2023-10-10/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

 The claim that 40 babies had been decapitated gained widespread attention on social media, with over 40 million impressions on [[Twitter|X]] (formerly Twitter), propagated by the Israeli website [[i24NEWS]] and the official Israel account. The claim made it to the front-page news on almost a dozen British newspapers. NBC News stated that the claim was likely erroneous, and based on the conflation of two separate statements made by IDF soldiers.<ref name="NBCnews" />
 
 == Survivors ==
-Ziv Stahl, executive director of the human rights organization [[Yesh Din]], survived the massacre and later, in an article for [[Haaretz]], strongly opposed calls to exact revenge, arguing that,'Indiscriminate bombing in Gaza and the killing of civilians uninvolved with these horrible crimes are no solution.'<ref>{{cite web|last=Noy|first=Orly|url=https://www.972mag.com/israeli-survivors-hamas-massacre-revenge/|title=Listen to Israeli survivors: They don’t want revenge|work=[[+972 Magazine]]|date=25 October 2023}}</ref>
+Ziv Stahl, executive director of the human rights organization [[Yesh Din]], survived the massacre and later, in an article for [[Haaretz]], strongly opposed calls to exact revenge, arguing that,'Indiscriminate bombing in Gaza and the killing of civilians uninvolved with these horrible crimes are no solution.'<ref>{{cite web|last=Noy|first=Orly|url=https://www.972mag.com/israeli-survivors-hamas-massacre-revenge/|title=Listen to Israeli survivors: They don't want revenge|work=[[+972 Magazine]]|date=25 October 2023}}</ref>

+
+On 9 January, Rik Peeperkorn, the WHO representative for Israel and Palestine, stated, "I’ve never seen so many amputees in my life, including among children. This will have such a long-term impact for everything."<ref>{{cite web |last1=Schlein |first1=Lisa |title=Health Catastrophe Unfolding in Gaza as Humanitarian Space Shrinks |url=https://www.voanews.com/a/health-catastrophe-unfolding-in-gaza-as-humanitarian-space-shrinks-/7432854.html |website=VOA |access-date=10 January 2024}}</ref>

-On December 5, clashes resulted in the injury of five Palestinians.<ref>{{cite web |title=More on Israel's hours-long raid on Jenin |url=https://aje.io/9qxx01?update=2536491 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=22 December 2023}}</ref> On December 6, a violent confrontation with the IDF resulted in the death of one teenage protester and injuries to two others.<ref>{{cite web |title=Israeli forces fatally shoot 16-year-old Palestinian boy in Yabad |url=https://www.dci-palestine.org/israeli_forces_fatally_shoot_16_year_old_palestinian_boy_in_yabad |website=Defense for Children |access-date=22 December 2023}}</ref> On 12 December, five Palestinians were killed, while another man was killed later that day.<ref>{{cite news |title=Israeli military kills six in Jenin, Palestinian officials say |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2023/dec/12/israel-gaza-war-live-updates-news-gaza-attack-palestine-un-ceasefire-vote-hostages?filterKeyEvents=false&page=with:block-657913d88f0889f38750ad89#block-657913d88f0889f38750ad89 |website=The Guardian | date=13 December 2023 |access-date=22 December 2023 | last1=Fulton | first1=Adam | last2=Oladipo | first2=Gloria | last3=Belam | first3=Martin | last4=Hall | first4=Rachel | last5=Ahmad | first5=Reged }}</ref> On December 13, a Palestinian protester was killed, and two others along with a child were wounded by Israeli gunfire.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Fabian |first1=Emanuel |title=IDF continues 30-hour Jenin operation; 7 Palestinians said killed in fighting |url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/idf-continues-30-hour-jenin-operation-7-palestinians-said-killed-in-fighting/ |website=The Times of Israel |access-date=22 December 2023}}</ref> On December 14, twelve Palestinians were killed in reported clashes.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Sawafta |first1=Ali |title=Israeli troops kill 12 Palestinians, desecrate West Bank mosque |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/three-palestinians-killed-by-israeli-forces-raid-jenin-health-ministry-2023-12-14/ |website=Reuters |access-date=22 December 2023}}</ref> 
+On December 5, clashes resulted in the injury of five Palestinians.<ref>{{cite web |title=More on Israel's hours-long raid on Jenin |url=https://aje.io/9qxx01?update=2536491 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=22 December 2023}}</ref> On December 6, a violent confrontation with the IDF resulted in the death of one teenage protester and injuries to two others.<ref>{{cite web |title=Israeli forces fatally shoot 16-year-old Palestinian boy in Yabad |url=https://www.dci-palestine.org/israeli_forces_fatally_shoot_16_year_old_palestinian_boy_in_yabad |website=Defense for Children |access-date=22 December 2023}}</ref> On 12 December, five Palestinians were killed, while another man was killed later that day.<ref>{{cite news |title=Israeli military kills six in Jenin, Palestinian officials say |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2023/dec/12/israel-gaza-war-live-updates-news-gaza-attack-palestine-un-ceasefire-vote-hostages?filterKeyEvents=false&page=with:block-657913d88f0889f38750ad89#block-657913d88f0889f38750ad89 |website=The Guardian | date=13 December 2023 |access-date=22 December 2023 | last1=Fulton | first1=Adam | last2=Oladipo | first2=Gloria | last3=Belam | first3=Martin | last4=Hall | first4=Rachel | last5=Ahmad | first5=Reged }}</ref> On December 13, a Palestinian protester was killed, and two others along with a child were wounded by Israeli gunfire.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Fabian |first1=Emanuel |title=IDF continues 30-hour Jenin operation; 7 Palestinians said killed in fighting |url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/idf-continues-30-hour-jenin-operation-7-palestinians-said-killed-in-fighting/ |website=The Times of Israel |access-date=22 December 2023}}</ref> On December 14, Israeli arrested about 60 wanted terrorists, over 50 weapons of various types confiscated, hundreds of explosives located, and terrorist funds worth over nis 100,000 found. IDF uncovered more than 10 underground shafts, 7 explosives laboratories and 5 observation posts designed to monitor Israel. some of the terrorist infrastructures were destroyed by the forces. also, they found lot's of ammunition and explosives, materials for making explosives, military equipment and weapon parts. The air force attacked two squads of terrorists who threw explosives and fired at the forces, killing seven terrorists and wounded others. Over ten terrorists, and a total of twelve Palestinians were killed in reported clashes.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Sawafta |first1=Ali |title=Israeli troops kill 12 Palestinians, desecrate West Bank mosque |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/three-palestinians-killed-by-israeli-forces-raid-jenin-health-ministry-2023-12-14/ |website=Reuters |access-date=22 December 2023}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.now14.co.il/10-%D7%A4%D7%99%D7%A8%D7%99%D7%9D-60-%D7%A2%D7%A6%D7%95%D7%A8%D7%99%D7%9D-%D7%94%D7%A1%D7%AA%D7%99%D7%99%D7%9D-%D7%94%D7%9E%D7%91%D7%A6%D7%A2-%D7%91%D7%9E%D7%97%D7%A0%D7%94-%D7%A4%D7%9C%D7%99%D7%98/ |title=10 פירים, 60 עצורים: הסתיים המבצע במחנה הפליטים ג'נין |newspaper=Now14 |date=December 14, 2023 |author=Elhanan Mazoz |accessdate= February 4, 2024}}</ref>
 A 17-year-old was reportedly shot and killed by IDF forces inside the Khalil Suleiman hospital compound near the Jenin refugee camp, accourding to accounts by the [[Médecins Sans Frontières|Doctors Without Borders]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite news |last= |date=2023-12-14 |title=IDF censures its soldiers filmed mocking call to prayer in Jenin mosque |language=en-GB |work=The Guardian |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/dec/14/idf-censures-its-soldiers-filmed-mocking-call-to-prayer-in-jenin-mosque |access-date=2023-12-14 |issn=0261-3077}}</ref>
 A female Israeli soldier shot and killed a Palestinian man on 22 December for attempting to move his car.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Fisher |first1=Alan |title=Israeli forces shoot Palestinian man near Jenin |url=https://aje.io/cvvtyk?update=2573523 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=23 December 2023}}</ref> Raids on 24 December in Jenin and multiple other areas in the West Bank resulted in more than ten arrests.<ref>{{cite web |title=Nearly a dozen arrested in Israeli raids in occupied West Bank |url=https://aje.io/53epb7?update=2577270 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=24 December 2023}}</ref> At least ten houses were raided on 25 December.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Khan |first1=Imran |title=Homes raided in Jenin refugee camp |url=https://aje.io/fm3fq7?update=2578371 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=25 December 2023}}</ref>

@@ -156,5 +156,5 @@
 In July 2014, a day after the burial of [[2014 kidnapping and murder of Israeli teenagers|three murdered Israeli teens]]. [[Kidnapping and murder of Mohammed Abu Khdeir|Abu Khdeir]], a 16-year-old [[Palestinian people|Palestinian]], was forced into a car on an [[East Jerusalem]] street by 3 Israelis, two teenagers led by a 30 year old settler from the West Bank settlement of [[Geva Binyamin|Adam]].<ref>[Aron Donzis, [http://www.timesofisrael.com/name-abu-khdeir-suspect-released/ 'Adult suspect in Abu Khdeir murder named,'] [[The Times of Israel]] 20 July 2015.</ref><ref>[[Peter Beaumont (journalist)|Peter Beaumont]],[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/jun/03/abu-khdeir-murder-trial-jerusalem 'Abu Khdeir murder trial: defendant tells court he did not plan to kill teenager,] [[The Guardian]] 3 June 2015.</ref>   His family immediately reported the fact to [[Israel Police|Israeli Police]] who located his charred body a few hours later at [[Givat Shaul]] in the [[Jerusalem Forest]]. Preliminary results from the autopsy suggested that he was beaten and burnt while still alive.<ref name="20140706NYT">{{cite news |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2014/07/07/world/middleeast/israel-palestinians-muhammad-abu-khdeir.html?_r=0 |title=Suspects Arrested in Death of Palestinian Youth, Israeli Police Say |last=Kershner |first=Isabel |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=6 July 2014 |accessdate=6 July 2014}}</ref><ref name="Autopsy" >{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=710089 |title=Official: Autopsy shows Palestinian youth burnt alive |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=5 July 2014 |accessdate=6 July 2014}}</ref><ref name="Maan: Palestinian teen abducted">{{cite news |url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=709299 |title=Palestinian teen abducted, killed in suspected revenge attack |publisher=[[Ma'an News Agency]] |date=2 July 2014 |accessdate=6 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url = http://www.timesofisrael.com/palestinian-teen-said-found-dead-in-jerusalem-forest/ |title = Arab teen killed in capital; revenge attack suspected |last = Ben Zion|first = Ilan|date = 2 July 2014 |publisher = The Times of Israel |accessdate = 2014-07-04 |deadurl=no |archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.timesofisrael.com%2Fpalestinian-teen-said-found-dead-in-jerusalem-forest%2F&date=2014-07-04&opaque_shortcut=http://www.webcitation.org/6Qonc02Oi |archivedate = 2014-07-04 |last2 = Berman |first2 = Lazar}}</ref> The murder suspects explained the attack as a response to the [[2014 kidnapping and murder of Israeli teenagers|June abduction and murder of three Israeli teens]].<ref name="Sharon">Assaf Sharon, [http://www.nybooks.com/articles/archives/2014/sep/25/failure-gaza "Failure in Gaza"], ''[[New York Review of Books]]'', 25 September 2014, pp. 20-24.</ref><ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url = http://www.kcra.com/news/family-of-slain-palestinian-teen-lives-in-sacramento/26792470#!8p7a7|title = Family of slain Palestinian teen lives in Sacramento|last = Hoff|first = Mallory|date = 3 July 2014|work = KCRA Television Sacramento|accessdate = 4 July 2014}}</ref> The murders contributed to a breakout of hostilities in the [[2014 Israel–Gaza conflict]].<ref name="NT Times">{{cite web | url=http://www.nytimes.com/2014/07/09/world/middleeast/israel-steps-up-offensive-against-hamas-in-gaza.html | title=Israel and Hamas Trade Attacks as Tension Rises | work=The New York Times | date=8 July 2014 | accessdate=13 November 2014 |author1=Eranger, Steven |author2=Kershner, Isabel }}</ref> While it has become a standard operating procedure in Israel to bulldoze the homes of terrorists and their families,<ref>Herb Keinon, Yonah Jeremy Bob,  [http://www.jpost.com/Diplomacy-and-Politics/Israel-to-renew-demolition-of-terrorists-homes-360274 'Israel is to renew its controversial policy – discontinued in 2005 – of destroying the homes of terrorists as a deterrent measure,'] [[Jerusalem Post]] 23 June 2014</ref><ref>Daniel Landes [http://forward.com/opinion/israel/201485/bulldoze-homes-of-jewish-terrorists-too/ 'Bulldoze Homes of Jewish Terrorists, Too,'] [[The Forward]] 5 July 2014.</ref><ref>Asher Schechter,[http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/.premium-1.627383 'Immoral, Ineffective: Destroying Terrorists' Homes Is Nothing but Empty Revenge,'] [[Haaretz]] 20 November 2014.</ref> and while the mother of the child requested their houses be demolished as are those of Palestinian terrorists,<ref>Chaim Levinson, The Associated Press,
 [http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/1.603317  'Israeli Police Arrest Six Suspects in Murder of Palestinian Teen,']  [[Haaretz]] 6 July 2014: "They need to treat them the way they treat us. They need to demolish their homes and round them up, the way they do it to our children," she added.</ref><ref>Daniel Estrin, [http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/mohammed-abu-khdeir-murder-mother-speaks-out-after-israeli-men-arrested-for-nationalistic-killing-9588080.html  'Mohammed Abu Khdeir murder: Mother speaks out after Israeli men arrested for 'nationalistic' killing,'] [[The Independent]] 7 July 2014</ref> none of the perpetrators' homes were targeted for demolition. While Palestinians are tried in military courts, West Bank settlers are tried in Israel in civil courts, and no Jewish terrorist homes have been demolished.<ref>Amos Guiora [https://books.google.com/books?id=OJo1SvK2qWUC&pg=PA99 ''Freedom from Religion: Rights and National Security,''] Oxford University Press USA, 2013 p.99.</ref> Demolition, the state has argued, does not apply to Jewish suspects of terrorism, because  'there is no need to deter potential Jewish terrorists.'<ref>Revital Hovet, [http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/.premium-1.629930 'Israel defends Only Razing Homes of Arab Terrorist, Not Jewish Ones,'] [[Haaretz]]  4 December 2014.</ref>  
-The [[European Union]] criticized Israel for 'failing to protect the Palestinian population'.<ref name="haaretz.com">http://www.haaretz.com/beta/.premium-1.668911</ref> when also in July 2015, a similar incident happened where Israeli settlers did an arson attack on two [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] houses, one of which was empty however the other had a family that resulted in the burning of a Palestinian infant and the four other members of his family were evacuated to the hospital suffering serious injuries.<ref>http://www.haaretz.com/news/israel/1.668871</ref> These two incidents received worldwide condemnation from the [[United States]], [[European Union]] and even the [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]].<ref name="haaretz.com"/>
+The [[European Union]] criticized Israel for 'failing to protect the Palestinian population'.<ref name="haaretz.com">http://www.haaretz.com/beta/.premium-1.668911</ref> when also in July 2015, a similar incident happened where Israeli settlers committed  an arson attack on two [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] houses (one of which was empty), however the other house  had a family inside. This  resulted in the burning to death  of a Palestinian infant, and the four other members of his family were evacuated to the hospital suffering serious injuries.<ref>http://www.haaretz.com/news/israel/1.668871</ref> These two incidents received worldwide condemnation from the [[United States]], [[European Union]] and even the [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]].<ref name="haaretz.com"/>
 
 ==International reactions==

@@ -47,6 +47,5 @@
 
 ====United States====
-An opinion by a legal adviser to the [[U.S. Department of State]] found the settlements contrary to international law in 1978. On April 21, 1978, [[Legal Adviser of the Department of State]] Herbert J. Hansel issued an opinion, on request from Congress, that creating the settlements "is inconsistent with international law", and against Article 49 of the Fourth Geneva Convention.<ref name=Kessler>{{Cite news | last = Kessler | first = Glenn | title = Old Legal Opinion Raises New Questions | work = The Washington Post | accessdate = 2010-10-29 | date = 2009-06-17 | url = https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/06/16/AR2009061603285.html }}</ref> Hansell found that "[w]hile Israel may undertake, in the occupied territories, actions necessary to meet its military needs and to provide for orderly government during the occupation, for the reasons indicated above the establishment of the civilian settlements in those territories is inconsistent with international law."<ref name="fmep.org">Matt Skarzynski, Jonathan H. van Melle, Foundation for Middle East Peace, and Holly Byker, Churches for Middle East Peace, [http://www.fmep.org/analysis/analysis/israeli-settlements-in-the-occupied-territories/ Statements on American Policy toward Settlements by U.S. Government Officials – 1968–2009] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090621120314/http://www.fmep.org/analysis/analysis/israeli-settlements-in-the-occupied-territories/# |date=2009-06-21 }}, June 8, 2009.</ref><ref name="autogenerated1">"Letter of the State Department Legal Advisor, Mr. Herbert J. Hansell, Concerning the Legality of Israeli Settlements in the Occupied Territories", cited in ''[http://domino.un.org/UNISPAL.nsf/eed216406b50bf6485256ce10072f637/2dfed17dc7dfae2a852563a9004c4055!OpenDocument Progress report – The human rights dimensions of population transfer including the implantation of settler] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080312004659/http://domino.un.org/UNISPAL.nsf/eed216406b50bf6485256ce10072f637/2dfed17dc7dfae2a852563a9004c4055!OpenDocument# |date=2008-03-12 }}'' prepared by Mr. Awn Shawhat Al-Khasawneh.</ref> This opinion, "has neither been revoked or revised",<ref name=Kessler /> and remains the policy of the United States according to Hansel, ''The Washington Post'', and the [[Rand Corporation]]'s Palestinian State Study Project,{{sfn|Rand|2007|p=16}}  and Secretary of State John Kerry,{{sfn|Sanger|2016}} The [[Lyndon B. Johnson|Johnson]], [[Richard Nixon|Nixon]], [[Gerald Ford|Ford]], [[Jimmy Carter|Carter]],{{sfn|Leverett|Leverett|2009}}
- and [[Barack Obama|Obama]] administrations all publicly characterized the settlements as illegal.
+An opinion by a legal adviser to the [[U.S. Department of State]] found the settlements contrary to international law in 1978. On April 21, 1978, [[Legal Adviser of the Department of State]] Herbert J. Hansel issued an opinion, on request from Congress, that creating the settlements "is inconsistent with international law", and against Article 49 of the Fourth Geneva Convention.<ref name=Kessler>{{Cite news | last = Kessler | first = Glenn | title = Old Legal Opinion Raises New Questions | work = The Washington Post | accessdate = 2010-10-29 | date = 2009-06-17 | url = https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/06/16/AR2009061603285.html }}</ref> Hansell found that "[w]hile Israel may undertake, in the occupied territories, actions necessary to meet its military needs and to provide for orderly government during the occupation, for the reasons indicated above the establishment of the civilian settlements in those territories is inconsistent with international law."<ref name="fmep.org">Matt Skarzynski, Jonathan H. van Melle, Foundation for Middle East Peace, and Holly Byker, Churches for Middle East Peace, [http://www.fmep.org/analysis/analysis/israeli-settlements-in-the-occupied-territories/ Statements on American Policy toward Settlements by U.S. Government Officials – 1968–2009] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090621120314/http://www.fmep.org/analysis/analysis/israeli-settlements-in-the-occupied-territories/# |date=2009-06-21 }}, June 8, 2009.</ref><ref name="autogenerated1">"Letter of the State Department Legal Advisor, Mr. Herbert J. Hansell, Concerning the Legality of Israeli Settlements in the Occupied Territories", cited in ''[http://domino.un.org/UNISPAL.nsf/eed216406b50bf6485256ce10072f637/2dfed17dc7dfae2a852563a9004c4055!OpenDocument Progress report – The human rights dimensions of population transfer including the implantation of settler] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080312004659/http://domino.un.org/UNISPAL.nsf/eed216406b50bf6485256ce10072f637/2dfed17dc7dfae2a852563a9004c4055!OpenDocument# |date=2008-03-12 }}'' prepared by Mr. Awn Shawhat Al-Khasawneh.</ref> This opinion, "has neither been revoked or revised",<ref name=Kessler /> and remains the policy of the United States according to Hansel, ''The Washington Post'', and the [[Rand Corporation]]'s Palestinian State Study Project,{{sfn|Rand|2007|p=16}}  and Secretary of State John Kerry,{{sfn|Sanger|2016}} The [[Lyndon B. Johnson|Johnson]], [[Richard Nixon|Nixon]], [[Gerald Ford|Ford]], [[Jimmy Carter|Carter]],{{sfn|Leverett|Leverett|2009}} and [[Barack Obama|Obama]] administrations all publicly characterized the settlements as illegal.
 
 The United States has never voted in favor of any UN Resolution calling the settlements illegal except for [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 465|Resolution 465]] in 1980, and in that case the Carter administration subsequently announced that the vote had been cast in error<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mfa.gov.il/MFA/ForeignPolicy/MFADocuments/Yearbook4/Pages/69%20Security%20Council%20Resolution%20465%20-1980-%20on%20the%20s.aspx|title=Security Council Resolution 465 (1980) on the situation in the territories] [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Israel)-Israel Ministry of Foreign Affairs]|publisher=}}</ref> due to miscommunication and would have [[Abstention|abstained]] as it had for [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 446|Resolution 446]] and [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 452|Resolution 452]]. Three US Ambassadors to the UN have stated that Israeli settlements are illegal: [[George H. W. Bush]] (later US president) on September 25, 1971, [[William Scranton]] on May 25, 1976,{{sfn|Mark|2001|p=11}}  and [[Samantha Power]] on December 23, 2016. {{sfn|Sengupta|Gladstone|2016}} [[United States Secretary of State|Secretaries of State]] [[Cyrus Vance]]{{sfn|Mark|2001|p=11}} and John Kerry<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.state.gov/secretary/remarks/2016/12/266119.htm|title=Remarks on Middle East Peace|last=|first=|date=|work=|newspaper=U.S. Department of State|quote=In fact, this resolution simply reaffirms statements made by the Security Council on the legality of settlements over several decades. It does not break new ground. In 1978, the State Department Legal Adviser advised the Congress on his conclusion that Israel’s government, the Israeli Government’s program of establishing civilian settlements in the occupied territory is inconsistent with international law, and we see no change since then to affect that fundamental conclusion.|access-date=2016-12-29|via=}}</ref> also said the settlements were illegal.

-The Association of Rape Crisis Centers in Israel {{ill|ARCCI|he|איגוד מרכזי הסיוע לנפגעות ונפגעי תקיפה מינית בישראל}} recently published the first comprehensive survey of the multiple accounts of sexual violence carried out during the attack. The 35 pages report suggests that the attacks were more widespread than initially believed, occurring at various locations across southern Israel. Shockingly, in some instances, rapes were carried out in the presence of an audience, including partners, family, or friends, with the apparent intention of increasing pain, humiliation and trauma for all present.  Israel has been accused of violating or failing to fulfil specific obligations it had committed to under various ceasefire agreements<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.parliament.uk/briefing-papers/SN04946.pdf |title=Gaza: The conflict between Israel and Hamas|author=Stephen Jones|publisher=House of Commons Library|date=22 January 2009|ref=SN/IA/04946}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/palestinianauthority/9694410/Gaza-Israel-Hamas-ceasefire-agreement-in-full.html|title=Gaza: Israel Hamas ceasefire agreement in full|newspaper=The Telegraph|year=2012|access-date=22 June 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180623133747/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/palestinianauthority/9694410/Gaza-Israel-Hamas-ceasefire-agreement-in-full.html|archive-date=23 June 2018|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.files.ethz.ch/isn/184470/SN06969.pdf|title=Gaza ceasefire agreement|author=Rob Page|publisher=House of Commons Library|year=2014|access-date=22 June 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180622111507/https://www.files.ethz.ch/isn/184470/SN06969.pdf|archive-date=22 June 2018|url-status=live}}</ref> on different occasions to alleviate or lift the blockade.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.economist.com/news/middle-east-and-africa/21607895-hamas-wants-two-big-concessions-it-may-not-get-them-why-hamas-fires-those-rockets |title=Conditions for a ceasefire: Why Hamas fires those rockets |newspaper=The Economist |access-date=22 July 2014 |date=19 July 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140722071814/http://www.economist.com/news/middle-east-and-africa/21607895-hamas-wants-two-big-concessions-it-may-not-get-them-why-hamas-fires-those-rockets |archive-date=22 July 2014 |url-status=live }}: "After the last big Israeli effort to stop the rockets, in November 2012, it was agreed that, along with a ceasefire, the blockade of Gaza would gradually be lifted and the crossings into Egypt and Israel would be opened. The ceasefire generally held, but the siege continued."</ref> "Crossings were repeatedly shut and buffer zones were reinstated. Imports declined, exports were blocked, and fewer Gazans were given exit permits to Israel and the West Bank."<ref>Harriet Sherwood, [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2010/nov/30/israel-accused-over-gaza-blockade Israel accused over 'cruel' Gaza blockade,'] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180621221237/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2010/nov/30/israel-accused-over-gaza-blockade |date=21 June 2018 }}  ''[[The Guardian]]'' 30 November 2010:'According to today's report, ''Dashed Hopes: Continuation of the Gaza Blockade,'' imports of construction materials are 11% of the 2007 pre-blockade levels. Despite having agreed to allow in materials for the United Nations Relief and Works Agency to rebuild its schools and clinics damaged or destroyed in the three-week war in 2008-09, Israel has permitted only 7% of the necessary amount.'</ref><ref>Martin Hartberg, [https://books.google.com/books?id=6QfSAQAAQBAJ&pg=PA2  ''Beyond Ceasefire: Ending the blockade of Gaza.'']  [[Oxfam]], 2012 p.2.</ref><ref>Ian Bickerton, [https://books.google.com/books?id=jf5GAQAAQBAJ&pg=PA238 ''The Arab-Israeli Conflict: A Guide for the Perplexed,''] [[A&C Black]], 2012 p.238:'In June 2008 Israel increased the severity of the blockade after Egypt brokered a ceasefire  . .'The exchange of rockets launched a retaliatory aerial assaults increased late in 2008 with Hamas and Israeli blaming each other for a breakdown in the ceasefire. The evidence suggests Israel broke the ceasefire with a raid into the Gaza Strip that killed six Hamas men on 4 Novembneer- the night of the presidential election in the USA.</ref><ref>[[Noam Chomsky]], in Elliot N. Dorff, Danya Ruttenberg, Louis E Newman (eds.),  [https://books.google.com/books?id=JgfA4moXzEoC&pg=PA26 ''Jewish Choices, Jewish Voices: War and National Security ,''] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171018122916/https://books.google.com/books?id=JgfA4moXzEoC&pg=PA26|date=18 October 2017}} [[Jewish Publication Society]], 2010 p.26 :'There were some partial ceasefires. But Israel maintained the siege and then violated ceasefire agreements directly. The most important instance of this was in 2008. Right before the Israeli invasion, there was a ceasefire. It was observed completely by Hamas. The Israeli government concedes that there was not a single Hamas rocket fired during the ceasefire. Israel nevertheless maintained the siege, and in November 2008, Israeli just invaded Gaza outright and killed half a dozen Hamas activists. After that, rockets started.'</ref><ref name="nathanthrall">[[Nathan Thrall]]. (21 August 2014). [https://www.lrb.co.uk/v36/n16/nathan-thrall/hamass-chances 'Hamas’s Chances,'] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180619163404/https://www.lrb.co.uk/v36/n16/nathan-thrall/hamass-chances |date=19 June 2018 }} [[London Review of Books]] Vol. 36 No. 16, pp.10-12: 'with 21 November 2012 ceasefire agreement Israel undertook to 'end attacks against Gaza by land, sea and air – including the 'targeting of individuals' (assassinations, typically by drone-fired missile) – and that the closure of Gaza would essentially end as a result of Israel’s 'opening the crossings and facilitating the movements of people and transfer of goods, and refraining from restricting residents' free movements and targeting residents in border areas' but Israel therefore saw little incentive in upholding its end of the deal. In the three months following the ceasefire, its forces made regular incursions into Gaza, strafed Palestinian farmers and those collecting scrap and rubble across the border, and fired at boats, preventing fishermen from accessing the majority of Gaza’s waters. . . Israel had committed to holding indirect negotiations with Hamas over the implementation of the ceasefire but repeatedly delayed them . . The talks never took place. The lesson for Hamas was clear. Even if an agreement was brokered by the US and Egypt, Israel could still fail to honour it.'</ref><ref>Adam Withnall,  [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/israel-gaza-conflict-israel-breaks-ceasefire-in-minutes-as-eight-year-old-girl-killed-in-air-strike-9645558.html  'Israel-Gaza conflict: Israel 'breaks ceasefire in minutes' as eight-year-old girl killed in air strike,'] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180621221209/https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/israel-gaza-conflict-israel-breaks-ceasefire-in-minutes-as-eight-year-old-girl-killed-in-air-strike-9645558.html |date=21 June 2018 }} [[The Independent]] I4 August 2014</ref><ref>[[Yousef Munayyer]], [http://www.thejerusalemfund.org/8747/israelgaza-cease-fire-dynamics-breakdown  'Israel/Gaza Cease-Fire Dynamics Breakdown,'] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180621194348/http://www.thejerusalemfund.org/8747/israelgaza-cease-fire-dynamics-breakdown |date=21 June 2018 }}  [[The Jerusalem Fund]] 2014</ref> PA President [[Mahmoud Abbas]] has expressed his approval of the Egyptian border restrictions. In 2014 and subsequent years, Abbas supported Egypt's crackdown on [[Gaza Strip smuggling tunnels|smuggling tunnels]], and welcomed the flooding of the tunnels by Egypt in coordination with the PA.<ref name=aljazeera1214/>
 
-The World Bank estimated in 2015 that the GDP losses caused by the blockade since 2007 was above 50%, and entailed large welfare losses. Gaza's manufacturing sector, once significant, shrunk by as much as 60 percent in real terms, due to the wars in the past 20 years and the blockade. Gaza's exports virtually disappeared since the imposition of the 2007 blockade. It stated that "solutions have to be found to enable faster inflow of construction materials into Gaza", while taking into account "legitimate security concerns of neighboring countries."<ref name="worldBankGDP" /> Since 2018, [[Qatar]] has been providing funding for Palestinians in Gaza. In February 2021, with Israeli approval, Qatar agreed to pay $360 million for the year to pay for fuel for Gaza’s power plant, pay civil servants and provide aid to tens of thousands of impoverished families.<ref> [https://www.al-monitor.com/originals/2021/02/gaza-aid-assistance-electricity-qatar-palestinians-israel.html Qatar announces new aid grant to Palestinians in Gaza]</ref><ref> https://www.timesofisrael.com/un-agrees-to-take-over-distribution-of-qatari-funds-in-gaza-report/ </ref> After the 11-day Gaza War in May 2021, Israel stopped the Qatari money coming into Gaza out of concern that it would be diverted to Hamas for military purposes.<ref> [https://www.jpost.com/middle-east/un-to-handle-the-disbursement-of-the-qatari-money-in-gaza-672809 Bennett: No more suitcases of cash for Hamas in Gaza]</ref> In July 2021, it was reported that the United Nations had agreed to oversee the distribution of the Qatari money to Gazans through banks affiliated with the [[Palestinian Monetary Authority]] in Ramallah. Israel agreed to the arrangement on condition that none of the money is diverted to Hamas.<ref> [https://www.jpost.com/middle-east/un-to-handle-the-disbursement-of-the-qatari-money-in-gaza-672809 UN to handle the disbursement of the Qatari money in Gaza] </ref>
+Since 2018, [[Qatar]] has been providing funding for Palestinians in Gaza. In February 2021, with Israeli approval, Qatar agreed to pay $360 million for the year to pay for fuel for Gaza’s power plant, pay civil servants and provide aid to tens of thousands of impoverished families.<ref> [https://www.al-monitor.com/originals/2021/02/gaza-aid-assistance-electricity-qatar-palestinians-israel.html Qatar announces new aid grant to Palestinians in Gaza]</ref><ref> https://www.timesofisrael.com/un-agrees-to-take-over-distribution-of-qatari-funds-in-gaza-report/ </ref> After the 11-day Gaza War in May 2021, Israel stopped the Qatari money coming into Gaza out of concern that it would be diverted to Hamas for military purposes.<ref> [https://www.jpost.com/middle-east/un-to-handle-the-disbursement-of-the-qatari-money-in-gaza-672809 Bennett: No more suitcases of cash for Hamas in Gaza]</ref> In July 2021, it was reported that the United Nations had agreed to oversee the distribution of the Qatari money to Gazans through banks affiliated with the [[Palestinian Monetary Authority]] in Ramallah. Israel agreed to the arrangement on condition that none of the money is diverted to Hamas.<ref> [https://www.jpost.com/middle-east/un-to-handle-the-disbursement-of-the-qatari-money-in-gaza-672809 UN to handle the disbursement of the Qatari money in Gaza] </ref>

@@ -98,4 +98,5 @@
 ===Second Intifada 2000-2005===
 {{Main|Second Intifada}}
+[[File:Faris_odeh03a.jpg|thumb|The iconic picture of [[Faris Odeh]], who was killed during the Second Intifada in early November 2000, throwing a stone at an Israeli tank in the [[Gaza Strip]].]]
 
 Following several years of unsuccessful negotiations, the conflict re-erupted as the [[Second Intifada]] in September 2000.<ref name="HistoryPBS" /> The violence, escalating into an open conflict between the [[Palestinian National Security Forces]] and the [[Israel Defense Forces]], lasted until 2004/2005 and led to approximately [[Operation Days of Penitence Fatalities|130 fatalities]]. In 2005, Israeli Prime Minister Sharon ordered the [[Israeli disengagement from Gaza|removal of Israeli settlers and soldiers from Gaza]]. Israel and its Supreme Court formally declared an end to occupation, saying it "had no effective control over what occurred" in Gaza.<ref name="cnn2009-01-06">{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/meast/01/06/israel.gaza.occupation.question/index.html|title=Is Gaza 'occupied' territory?|last=Levs|first=Josh|date=6 January 2009|publisher=CNN|access-date=30 May 2009|archive-date=21 January 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090121084340/http://www.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/meast/01/06/israel.gaza.occupation.question/index.html|url-status=live}}</ref> However, the [[United Nations]], [[Human Rights Watch]] and many other international bodies and [[Non-governmental organization|NGOs]] continue to consider Israel to be the occupying power of the Gaza Strip as Israel controls Gaza Strip's airspace, territorial waters and controls the movement of people or goods in or out of Gaza by air or sea.<ref name="cnn2009-01-06"/><ref name="AI_briefing">{{cite web |url=https://www.amnesty.org/en/documents/mde15/007/2009/en/ |title=Israel/Occupied Palestinian Territories: The conflict in Gaza: A briefing on applicable law, investigations and accountability |date=2009-01-19 |publisher=[[Amnesty International]] |access-date=2009-06-05 |archive-date=15 April 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150415160014/https://www.amnesty.org/en/documents/mde15/007/2009/en/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="isrlpa13698">{{Cite web|date=2006-07-05|title=Human Rights Council Special Session on the Occupied Palestinian Territories, July 6, 2006|url=https://www.hrw.org/news/2006/07/05/human-rights-council-special-session-occupied-palestinian-territories-july-6-2006|access-date=2022-03-05|website=Human Rights Watch|language=en|archive-date=4 January 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120104173325/https://www.hrw.org/news/2006/07/05/human-rights-council-special-session-occupied-palestinian-territories-july-6-2006|url-status=live}}</ref>
