@@ -32,11 +32,11 @@
 Throughout 2006, the [[Karni crossing]] remained only partially operational, costing Palestinians losses of $500,000 a day, as less than 10% of the Gaza Strip's minimal daily export targets were achieved. Basic food commodities were severely depleted, bakeries closed and food rationing was introduced.<ref>''Report of the Committee on the Exercise of the Inalienable Rights of the Palestinian People.''Sixty-first session, Supplement No.35 (A/61/35). October 2005 – October 2006, United Nations Publications, New York, p.8</ref>
 
-== Palestinian Authority support of the Egyptian blockade actions ==
+== Palestinian Authority support of blockade actions ==
 
-Linked with the [[Fatah–Hamas conflict|conflict following his party's loss in the 2006 election]], President Mahmoud Abbas expressed his approval of the Egyptian border restrictions. In 2014 and subsequent years, Abbas supported Egypt's crackdown on [[Gaza Strip smuggling tunnels|smuggling tunnels]], which were Gaza's last lifeline to the outer world, and he welcomed the flooding of the tunnels by Egypt in coordination with the Palestinian Authority (PA).<ref>[http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2014/12/abbas-supports-egypt-action-gaza-tunnels-2014121265210713278.html ''Abbas 'supports' Egypt action on Gaza tunnels'']. Al Jazeera, 12 December 2014</ref><ref name=memo_tunnels_flooded>[https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/news/africa/21303-sisi-says-gaza-tunnels-flooded-in-coordination-with-pa ''Sisi says Gaza tunnels flooded in coordination with PA'']. MEMO, 28 September 2015</ref><ref name=haaretz_abbas>[https://www.haaretz.com/news/middle-east/.premium-1.629397 ''Abbas: Egypt Right to Create Buffer Zone on Gaza Border''] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150820105818/https://www.haaretz.com/news/middle-east/.premium-1.629397 |date=20 August 2015 }}. Jack Khoury, Haaretz, 1 December 2014 (premium).<br>″Abbas believed the destruction of the tunnels was the best solution. The Palestinian president said he had recommended previously the sealing or destruction of the tunnels by flooding them and then punishing the owners of the homes that contained entrances to the tunnels, including demolishing their homes.″</ref>
+Linked with the [[Fatah–Hamas conflict|conflict following his party's loss in the 2006 election]], President Mahmoud Abbas expressed his approval of the Egyptian border restrictions by the new regime, purportedly aimed at protecting Egypt from danger. In 2014 and subsequent years, Abbas supported Egypt's crackdown on [[Gaza Strip smuggling tunnels|smuggling tunnels]], which were Gaza's last lifeline to the outer world, and he welcomed the flooding of the tunnels by Egypt in coordination with the Palestinian Authority (PA).<ref>[http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2014/12/abbas-supports-egypt-action-gaza-tunnels-2014121265210713278.html ''Abbas 'supports' Egypt action on Gaza tunnels'']. Al Jazeera, 12 December 2014</ref><ref name=memo_tunnels_flooded>[https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/news/africa/21303-sisi-says-gaza-tunnels-flooded-in-coordination-with-pa ''Sisi says Gaza tunnels flooded in coordination with PA'']. MEMO, 28 September 2015</ref><ref name=haaretz_abbas>[https://www.haaretz.com/news/middle-east/.premium-1.629397 ''Abbas: Egypt Right to Create Buffer Zone on Gaza Border''] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150820105818/https://www.haaretz.com/news/middle-east/.premium-1.629397 |date=20 August 2015 }}. Jack Khoury, Haaretz, 1 December 2014 (premium).<br>″Abbas believed the destruction of the tunnels was the best solution. The Palestinian president said he had recommended previously the sealing or destruction of the tunnels by flooding them and then punishing the owners of the homes that contained entrances to the tunnels, including demolishing their homes.″</ref>
 
-Abbas also objected to the entrance of Qatari fuel to the Gaza electricity plant via Israel, because his PA would be unable to collect taxes on the fuel.<ref>[https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/news/middle-east/23968-yaalon-abbas-objected-to-qatari-fuel-entering-gaza-through-ashdod ''Ya’alon: Abbas objected to Qatari fuel entering Gaza through Ashdod'']. MEMO, 17 February 2016</ref>
+Abbas objected to the entrance of Qatari fuel to the Gaza electricity plant via Israel, because his PA would be unable to collect taxes on the fuel.<ref>[https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/news/middle-east/23968-yaalon-abbas-objected-to-qatari-fuel-entering-gaza-through-ashdod ''Ya’alon: Abbas objected to Qatari fuel entering Gaza through Ashdod'']. MEMO, 17 February 2016</ref>
 
-Abbas and his party Fatah also opposed the opening of the [[Rafah Border Crossing]] if Hamas would take part in the monitoring in addition to the [[Palestinian Presidential Guard|Presidential Guard]]. Fatah and the PA condemned Turkish-Israeli talks to restore relations that may lead to lifting the siege on Gaza through the building of a [[Gaza Seaport plans|seaport]], out of fear that Gaza may separate from the West Bank.<ref>[https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/news/middle-east/24242-palestinian-factions-welcome-turkish-efforts-to-lift-gaza-siege ''Palestinian factions welcome Turkish efforts to lift Gaza siege'']. MEMO, 1 March 2016</ref>
+In 2016 most Palestinian parties welcomed Turkish initiatives to end the strict Israeli siege on the Gaza Strip by building a [[Gaza Seaport plans|seaport]] for the movement of people and goods. This step was condemned by Fatah and the PA, a senior Fatah leader saying that his movement would not allow this to happen, while the Fatah Executive Committee said this was an Israeli trick to separate Gaza from the West Bank. In turn a Hamas official condemned the Palestinian Authority’s position; “This position proves that the PA is part of the Israeli-led siege which has been imposed on Gaza for ten years.”<ref>[https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/news/middle-east/24242-palestinian-factions-welcome-turkish-efforts-to-lift-gaza-siege ''Palestinian factions welcome Turkish efforts to lift Gaza siege'']. MEMO, 1 March 2016</ref>

Why did they keep it? Do they have the right to do so? And will they apologise to the child’s family?"<ref>{{cite web |title=Israel releases body of toddler killed by soldiers nine days ago |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/1/16/israels-war-on-gaza-live-at-least-132-killed-in-gaza-in-last-24-hours?update=2625219 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=17 January 2024}}</ref> Palestinians in the West Bank stated the Israeli army regularly used bulldozers to destroy roads and infrastructure, describing the process as a form of [[collective punishment]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Jamjoom |first1=Mohammed |title=Familiar 'trail of devastation' after latest occupied West Bank raids |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/1/16/israels-war-on-gaza-live-at-least-132-killed-in-gaza-in-last-24-hours?update=2623486 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=17 January 2024}}</ref> The Israeli military described the situation in the West Bank as "spiraling out of control".<ref>{{cite web |last1=Salhut |first1=Hamdah |title=Israel redeploys elite unit from Gaza to West Bank, situation 'spiralling' |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/1/16/israels-war-on-gaza-live-at-least-132-killed-in-gaza-in-last-24-hours?update=2623356 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=17 January 2024}}</ref> Residents stated they believed Israel was attempting to turn them against the local resistance fighters.<ref>{{cite web |title=More on Israeli attack on Balata refugee camp |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/1/17/israels-war-on-gaza-live-brutality-of-gaza-crisis-unprecedented-un?update=2626640 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=18 January 2024}}</ref> [[Melani Cammett]], an American political scientist, stated on 18 January that the intensification of fighting in the West Bank indicated the war "is nowhere near over".<ref>{{cite web |title=Gaza war spillover into West Bank suggests conflict 'nowhere near over' |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/1/18/israels-war-on-gaza-live-medicine-arrives-for-captives-palestinians?update=2630268 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=19 January 2024}}</ref>
 
-On 18 January, Australian foreign minister [[Penny Wong]] visited the occupied West Bank, stating, "Australia is deeply concerned by ongoing settler violence against Palestinians in the West Bank".<ref>{{cite web |title=Australian foreign minister 'concerned' by settler violence in West Bank |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/1/18/israels-war-on-gaza-live-medicine-arrives-for-captives-palestinians?update=2628875 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=19 January 2024}}</ref> The same day, [[OHCHR]] called for an independent probe into the growing number of "unlawful" killings in the West Bank.<ref>{{cite web |title=UN calls for independent probe of Israel's killings of Palestinians in occupied West Bank |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/1/18/israels-war-on-gaza-live-medicine-arrives-for-captives-palestinians?update=2628852 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=19 January 2024}}</ref>
+On 18 January, Australian foreign minister [[Penny Wong]] visited the occupied West Bank, stating, "Australia is deeply concerned by ongoing settler violence against Palestinians in the West Bank".<ref>{{cite web |title=Australian foreign minister 'concerned' by settler violence in West Bank |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/1/18/israels-war-on-gaza-live-medicine-arrives-for-captives-palestinians?update=2628875 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=19 January 2024}}</ref> The same day, [[OHCHR]] called for an independent probe into the growing number of "unlawful" killings in the West Bank.<ref>{{cite web |title=UN calls for independent probe of Israel's killings of Palestinians in occupied West Bank |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/1/18/israels-war-on-gaza-live-medicine-arrives-for-captives-palestinians?update=2628852 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=19 January 2024}}</ref> On 19 January, UNRWA chief [[Philippe Lazzarini]] warned the West Bank was witnessing its highest levels of violence in "a tragic cycle of pain and suffering."<ref>{{cite web |title=Highest levels of violence in occupied West Bank: UN official |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/1/19/israels-war-on-gaza-live-us-support-for-israel-ironclad-despite-rebuff?update=2634203 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=20 January 2024}}</ref>
